senses.de: A part or feature of something
senses.ex: We need to consider every aspect of the problem

Tips.title: Part of Whole
Tips.description: Consider 'aspect' as an element that helps to understand the complete picture of a topic.
Tips.example: Studying biology involves exploring different aspects of living organisms.

Tips.title: Multiperspective Analysis
Tips.description: 'Aspect' encourages looking at issues from multiple angles to gain a comprehensive understanding.
Tips.example: Let's discuss the ethical aspects of artificial intelligence.

senses.de: The direction that a structure faces
senses.ex: The house has a southern aspect

Tips.title: Not Emotional
Tips.description: In geography, 'aspect' does not convey feelings but strictly refers to physical direction.
Tips.example: The mountain's northern aspect is ideal for skiing.

Tips.title: Sunlight Consideration
Tips.description: 'Aspect' can imply how much sunlight a place receives, which affects temperature and plant life.
Tips.example: Plants that love shade thrive on the eastern aspect of the house.

senses.de: The appearance of someone or something to the eye or mind
senses.ex: This document gives an overview of every aspect of the project

Tips.title: First Impression
Tips.description: An 'aspect' can shape the initial impression of a person or situation before details are known.
Tips.example: His calm aspect reassured the audience.

Tips.title: Surface Evaluation
Tips.description: The term 'aspect' can suggest a superficial evaluation rather than a deep analysis.
Tips.example: I've checked the financial aspect of the plan, but more review is needed.

senses.de: A specific way in which something can be considered
senses.ex: We need to consider the problem from every aspect

Tips.title: Analysis Approach
Tips.description: Understanding different 'aspects' can help assess a topic from various approaches or disciplines.
Tips.example: The psychological aspect is just as important as the physical one in sports.

Tips.title: Diverse Perspectives
Tips.description: 'Aspect' can remind us that everyone may view the same thing in a unique way.
Tips.example: The cultural aspect offers a different perspective on the issue.

senses.de: A way in which a verb (action word) can be done, such as in the past, present, or future
senses.ex: In English, we change the aspect of a verb to show if an action is completed or ongoing

Tips.title: Verb Action Time
Tips.description: In linguistics, 'aspect' reveals whether an action is finished, ongoing, or repeated.
Tips.example: She is writing a letter - 'is writing' shows a continuous aspect.

Tips.title: Verb Action Nature
Tips.description: 'Aspect' highlights the nature of the action taken by the verb, not just when it happened.
Tips.example: He had eaten before arriving, showing a perfect aspect.

Angle.wordDefinition:
Angle and aspect are similar in some ways but also have different meanings.

Angle refers to the measurement of the space between two lines or surfaces that meet at a point.

It is used in geometry, math, and in daily life to describe the position of an object or the direction of a movement. For example, you might describe the angle at which a ball was thrown, or the angle of a triangle.

Angle is a mathematical term used to measure the space between two lines or surfaces, while aspect describes a particular feature or part of something.

Attribute.wordDefinition:
An aspect is a particular feature or part of something, while an attribute is a quality or characteristic that defines or describes something or someone.

For example, the aspect of a car could be its color, while an attribute of the car could be its speed.

Aspects are usually used when talking about physical features, while attributes can refer to both physical and non-physical aspects.

Attributes can also describe a person's personality traits or qualities.

An aspect is a more specific part or feature of something, while an attribute is a broader quality or characteristic that defines that thing or person.

Characteristic.wordDefinition:
Aspect refers to a specific feature or part of something, while the word characteristic refers to a typical or defining trait of something.

For example, if you were describing a car, you could say that one aspect of it is its color or its size. But the car's characteristic might be that it is fast or fuel-efficient.

Aspects are used to describe the different parts of something, while characteristics are used to define what makes it unique.

Element.wordDefinition:
Aspect refers to a particular feature or quality of something, while the word element refers to a basic component or part of something.

The elements of an ecosystem might include water, sunlight, soil, and the various organisms that live within it. These are fundamental parts that make up the ecosystem as a whole.

Aspect is more often used to describe subjective or abstract qualities, while element describes more concrete, tangible parts or components.

Facet.wordDefinition:
Both words refer to different sides or parts of something. Aspect is typically used when discussing a broad view or perspective of something, whereas facet describes a specific feature or characteristic.

For example, you might say that a diamond has many facets, meaning that it has many different angles and surfaces that make it sparkle.

Aspect often refers to overall views or themes, while facet refers to specific details or features.

Feature.wordDefinition:
Aspect refers to a particular part or characteristic of something, while feature refers to a distinct part or element of something that makes it unique or distinguishable.

For example, in a car, an aspect could be the color, while a feature could be the sunroof. In a smartphone, an aspect could be the size of the screen, while a feature could be a fingerprint scanner.

Aspect is more general and can be used to refer to any part or characteristic of something, while feature is more specific and implies a certain level of uniqueness or importance.

Perspective.wordDefinition:
Perspective refers to a particular point of view or way of looking at something. For example, one might have a different perspective on a situation based on their life experiences or beliefs.

However, aspect usually refers to a specific thing while perspective focuses more on the way someone sees things.

Quality.wordDefinition:
Quality refers to how good or bad something is. For example, if you're talking about the quality of a meal, it could refer to how tasty it was, how healthy it was, or how well it was cooked.

Aspect describes a particular feature of something, while quality describes how good or bad it is overall.

quotes.Text: When you play a videogame, you could be a completely different person than you are in the real world, certain aspects of the way your brain works can be leveraged for something you could never do in the real world.
quotes.Title: British Director
quotes.Name: Christopher Nolan

quotes.Text: The business aspect is one of the most important things about having a music career, because every choice you make in a management meeting affects your life a year-and-a-half from now.
quotes.Title: American Singer
quotes.Name: Taylor Swift

quotes.Text: As an artist, I used to think that my responsibility was to do good work. But I had to learn from the '70s on that being a public figure presents another aspect of responsibility.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Patti Smith

quotes.Text: We see our customers as invited guests to a party, and we are the hosts. It's our job every day to make every important aspect of the customer experience a little bit better.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Jeff Bezos

quotes.Text: You're not free unless you can show the good and the bad, all sides of them. So to me, when I play a character, it's important that I can show every aspect of them.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Chadwick Boseman

quotes.Text: Well, I think in my own work the subject matter usually deals with characters I know, aspects of myself, friends of mine - that sort of thing.
quotes.Title: American Director
quotes.Name: Martin Scorsese

quotes.Text: I think some aspects of writing can be taught. Obviously, you can't teach vision or talent. But you can help with comfort.
quotes.Title: American Novelist
quotes.Name: Toni Morrison

quotes.Text: The more aspects of life that can be moved from private reign to public realm, the better it is for politics.
quotes.Title: American Comedian
quotes.Name: P. J. O'Rourke

quotes.Text: The saddest aspect of life right now is that science gathers knowledge faster than society gathers wisdom.
quotes.Title: American Scientist
quotes.Name: Isaac Asimov

quotes.Text: I'm a total control freak and love to participate in the design of every single aspect of life.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Drew Barrymore
